title: Pride of Britain Awards: Tom Daley, 25, and Dustin Lance Black, 45, look dapper on the red carpet
text:
They tied the knot in a romantic ceremony at Bovey Castle in Devon in May 2017.

And Tom Daley and Dustin Lance Black looked every inch the happy couple as they attended the Pride of Britain Awards at Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday.

The diver, 25, and the Oscar-winning filmmaker, 45, both looked dapper as they made their way down the red carpet at the star-studded event.

Event: Tom Daley, 25, and Dustin Lance Black, 45, looked every inch the happy couple as they attended the Pride of Britain Awards at Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday

Tom donned a black blazer with matching trousers and loafers which he paired with a white shirt and a burgundy tie.

Dustin sported a navy blazer with a matching tie, also wearing black trousers and a white shirt.

The couple are parents to son Robert Ray who was born in June 2018.

Their outing comes after Dustin lifted the lid on his 'mind-blowing life' as a first-time father with his husband during his televised appearance on Lorraine.

Couple: The diver and the Oscar-winning filmmaker both looked dapper as they made their way down the red carpet at the star-studded event

He said: 'Baby is great, he is almost one years old. He’s up to eight teeth, he’s starting to stand. It blows my mind. I have this new set of eyes that I get to see the world through.'

Despite both leading busy lifestyles, Dustin revealed he takes over baby duty during the night.

The Milk writer explained: 'He needs his rest in order to be safe in practice. He works out six days a week… so I do the night whatever if he wakes up.

'Those blessed Saturday nights, because Tom doesn’t have practice on a Sunday, I get to sleep throughout.'

Style: Tom donned a black blazer with matching trousers and loafers which he paired with a white shirt and a burgundy tie

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars came together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
